title: Accept location as either ubid or uuid
description:
This is the first step in the process.  When rolling out this change, you could have a GET request to display a page go to a new version of the code, but the POST request when submitted to go to the old version of the code.  This allows for that to work without breaking, using a multi-step commit process:

1) Application only accepts uuid format
2) This commit
3) New versions accept uuid or ubid, old versions accept uuid only,
   uuid is used for submission in all versions
4) After a few minutes, all versions accept uuid or ubid
5) Future commit that switches to submitting ubid
6) All versions accept uuid or ubid, new versions submit ubid,
   old versions submit uuid
7) After a few minutes, all versions accept uuid or ubid, and submit
   ubid
8) Future commit that drops support for uuid
9) All versions submit ubid, new versions only accept ubid, old versions
   accept both
10) After a few minutes, all versions only accept ubid and only submit
   ubid
ellipsis_summary:
Transition location handling from UUID to UBID format across models, helpers, tests, and views.
> 
>   - **Behavior**:
>     - Removed UUID handling in `clover.rb` to transition to UBID format.
>     - Updated `check_visible_location` in `helpers/general.rb` to use `ubid_uuid`.
>   - **Models**:
>     - Added UBID constants for locations in `location.rb`.
>   - **Tests**:
>     - Updated location identifiers to UBID format in `firewall_spec.rb`, `kubernetes_cluster_spec.rb`, and `private_subnet_spec.rb`.
>     - Modified tests in `postgres_spec.rb` and `vm_spec.rb` to use UBID for location selection.
>   - **Views**:
>     - Changed location selection to use UBID in `resource_creation_form.erb` and `show.erb`.
>

title: Allow md5 in pg_hba.conf
description: We still use scram-sha-256 as default password encryption method. Even if the authentication method is set to md5, PostgreSQL uses scram-sha-256 if the password is encrypted with scram-sha-256, but not the other way around. By allowing md5 in pg_hba.conf, users coming from legacy systems can still use md5 authentication without having to change their passwords, while ensuring that new users are created and authenticated with scram-sha-256.
ellipsis_summary:
Allows `md5` authentication in `pg_hba.conf` while maintaining `scram-sha-256` as the default encryption, supporting legacy systems without password changes.
> 
>   - **Behavior**:
>     - Allows `md5` authentication in `pg_hba.conf` in `rhizome/postgres/bin/configure`.
>     - Maintains `scram-sha-256` as the default password encryption method.
>     - Supports legacy systems using `md5` without requiring password changes.
>   - **Configuration**:
>     - Updates `pg_hba.conf` to allow `md5` authentication for all connections.
>     - Ensures `scram-sha-256` is used if the password is encrypted with it, even if `md5` is specified.
>

Release notes

dRuby 2.2.3 - 2025-05-21

Improvement

  • Added support for "Changelog" link in RubyGems.org page.

    • GH-30
    • Patch by Mark Young

  • Dropped ObjectSpace._id2ref dependency because ObjectSpace._id2ref is deprecated. Drb::WeakIdConv is meaningless by this. So it's deprecated. Use the default ID converter instead.

    • GH-35
    • https://bugs.ruby-lang.org/issues/15711

Fixes

  • SSL: Fixed wrong certificate version.
    • GH-29

Thanks

  • Mark Young
Changelog

Sourced from drb's changelog.

2.2.3 - 2025-05-21

Improvement

  • Added support for "Changelog" link in RubyGems.org page.

    • GH-30
    • Patch by Mark Young

  • Dropped ObjectSpace._id2ref dependency because ObjectSpace._id2ref is deprecated. Drb::WeakIdConv is meaningless by this. So it's deprecated. Use the default ID converter instead.

    • GH-35

Release notes

Sourced from rubocop's releases.

RuboCop v1.75.7

Bug fixes

  • #14185: Fix an error for Style/IfUnlessModifierOfIfUnless when using nested modifier. (@​koic)
  • #14192: Fix negatives for Layout/SpaceBeforeBrackets when using space between method argument parentheses and left bracket. (@​koic)
  • #14189: Fix incorrect autocorrect for Layout/SpaceBeforeBrackets when using space between receiver and left brackets, and a space inside left bracket. (@​koic)
  • #14170: Fix Style/AccessModifierDeclarations cop error on semicolon after modifier. (@​viralpraxis)
  • #14195: Fix Style/AccessModifierDeclarations cop error on symbol modifier without surrounding scope. (@​viralpraxis)
  • #14172: Fix Style/AccessModifierDeclarations cop false positives when there are no method definitions and style is inline. (@​viralpraxis)
  • #14193: Fix Lint/UselessAssignment cop error when using nested assignment with splat. (@​earlopain)

Changes

  • #14188: Enhance Gemspec/DuplicatedAssignment cop to detect duplicated indexed assignment. (@​viralpraxis)
  • #14183: Recognize prefix argument for delegate method in Lint/DuplicateMethods. (@​lovro-bikic)

RuboCop v1.75.6

Bug fixes

  • #14176: Fix an error for Style/MultilineIfModifier when using nested modifier. (@​koic)
  • #14077: Change nil representation in todo file comments. (@​jonas054)

title: Do not create cert related strands when LB doesn't need certs
description: Prior to this commit, we would create strands for putting or removing certs for VMs belonging to a LoadBalancer which didn't need to provision certificates.
ellipsis_summary:
Ensure certificate strands are created only when load balancer requires certificates by checking `cert_enabled_lb?`.
> 
>   - **Behavior**:
>     - Modify `add_vm`, `detach_vm`, and `evacuate_vm` in `load_balancer.rb` to conditionally create strands for certificate operations only if `cert_enabled_lb?` is true.
>     - Introduce `cert_enabled_lb?` method in `load_balancer.rb` to check if the load balancer requires certificates based on `health_check_protocol`.
>   - **Tests**:
>     - Add tests in `load_balancer_spec.rb` for `detach_vm` to verify strand creation is conditional on `cert_enabled_lb?`.
>     - Add test for `cert_enabled_lb?` in `load_balancer_spec.rb` to ensure it returns false when `health_check_protocol` is not `https`.
>     - Update `load_balancer_nexus_spec.rb` to reflect changes in load balancer assembly with `health_check_protocol`.
> 
>

title: Prevent N+1 query issue in Model#has_resources
description:

While here, rename RESOURCE_ASSOCIATIONS to
RESOURCE_ASSOCIATION_DATASET_METHODS, so the symbol is only calculated once, and not recalculated per call per association.
ellipsis_summary:
Fixes N+1 query issue in `Project#has_resources` by using `github_runners` association and renames `RESOURCE_ASSOCIATIONS` for clarity.
> 
>   - **Behavior**:

>     - Queries now return single row/column, improving performance.
>   - **Renames**:

title: GPU VMs
description:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9534da5a-1c75-4935-bae4-20d1ded4800f)

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e52c14fe-6b61-457f-90d7-fecc7fbf4a87)

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a8d03aa3-5276-44ac-9522-b9a804677256)

---

*Enable creation of GPU-enabled VMs via the UI*

Allows users to create GPU-enabled VMs through the UI. Only available
GPU options are shown - if a specific GPU type is unavailable in a
region, it will not be listed. The option to attach a GPU is visible
only for projects with the `gpu_vm` feature flag enabled.

---

*Enable programmatic creation of GPU-enabled VMs*
    
Allows VMs with GPUs to be created programmatically when the `gpu_vm`
feature flag is enabled. The corresponding UI support will be
implemented in a subsequent PR.

---

*Show gpu field on vm detail card*

When the `gpu_vm` feature flag is set, show the `gpu` field on the
detail card. It shows `-` if no GPU is attached, otherwise it displays
information about the GPU such as `2x NVIDIA A100 80GB PCIe`.

---

*Add GPU configuration to VM serializer*

Add a new field `gpu` to the detailed section of VM. It would contain
`2x NVIDIA A100 80GB PCIe" in case 2 GPUs of device type 20b5
are attached to the VM.

---

*Remove gpu field from Option::VmSize*

The gpu boolean field is unused and lacks expressiveness.
It does not account for:
    * The number of GPUs attached to a VM
    * The specific type of GPU attached

This change removes the field in favor of more precise mechanisms for
representing GPU configurations.

---

*Enable VM assembly with specific gpu_device*
    
The allocator now supports requesting specific GPU devices for a VM.
This commit extends Nexus to include the gpu_device field, allowing it
to assemble VMs with the requested GPU type.

---

*Enhance allocator to recognize GPU device types*
    
Previously, the allocator could not differentiate between GPU types.
With this update, it can now handle requests for specific GPU
models, ensuring that VMs are provisioned with the desired GPU type.

---

*Add gpu_vm feature flag*

Enables GPU-equipped virtual machines for individual projects to support
testing and phased rollout.

---

*Billing rate for A100 GPUs in hetzner-fsn1*

Reference for what `20b5` stands for:
https://github.com/akash-network/provider-configs/blob/98f5bce184a7e45a78c5aa36953e6d813508f435/devices/pcie/gpus.json#L30
ellipsis_summary:
Add support for creating and managing GPU-enabled virtual machines with UI and programmatic methods, gated by a feature flag.
> 
>   - **Behavior**:
>     - Enable GPU VM creation via UI and programmatically when `gpu_vm` feature flag is enabled.
>     - Display GPU field on VM detail card if GPU is attached.
>     - Only show available GPU options based on region.
>   - **Validation**:
>     - Add validation for GPU count and type in `validation.rb`.
>     - Ensure GPU is not available for burstable VMs or unsupported types.
>   - **Allocation**:
>     - Update `allocator.rb` to support GPU device requests.
>     - Modify `VmHostAllocation` and `GpuAllocation` to handle GPU resources.
>   - **Serialization**:
>     - Add GPU information to VM serialization in `serializers/vm.rb`.
>   - **UI**:
>     - Update `vm/create.erb` and `vm/show.erb` to include GPU options and display.
>   - **Testing**:
>     - Add tests for GPU VM creation and validation in `vm_spec.rb` and `allocator_spec.rb`.
> 
>

title: Prevent allocation of non-GPU VMs on GPU hosts
description:
Previously, allocating non-GPU VMs on GPU-equipped hosts was
discouraged but still possible. With this change, such allocations are
now disallowed. The only exception is when a host is explicitly
selected using a host filter override.
ellipsis_summary:
Disallow non-GPU VM allocation on GPU hosts unless a host filter override is used, with updates to `allocator.rb` and corresponding tests in `allocator_spec.rb`.
> 
>   - **Behavior**:
>     - Disallow allocation of non-GPU VMs on GPU hosts in `allocator.rb` unless a host filter override is used.
>     - Modify `candidate_hosts` function to exclude GPU hosts for non-GPU VM requests unless `host_filter` is specified.
>   - **Tests**:
>     - Add test case in `allocator_spec.rb` to verify non-GPU VMs are not allocated on GPU hosts without host filter override.
>     - Update existing tests to align with new allocation logic.
> 
>

title: Emit a route exception for committee response errors
description:
I'm not sure why we would want to not emit this error, as this error should 100% of the time be the result of a bug in the application or in openapi.yml. If committee accepts the request, it should accept the application's response to the request. Hiding these errors only complicates debugging.

CC @geemus
ellipsis_summary:
Removes `Committee::InvalidResponse` from error handling in `clover.rb`, allowing these errors to be emitted for easier debugging.
> 
>   - **Behavior**:
>     - Removes `Committee::InvalidResponse` from error handling in `clover.rb`, allowing these errors to be emitted instead of being caught silently.
>   - **Error Handling**:
>     - Now only `Sequel::SerializationFailure` is caught in the specific error handling case, leading to a 500 error response.
> 
>

title: Revert dispatcher rewrite
description:
It has some bugs that need to be fixed, and the current tests are insufficient and need to be updated as well.

Revert "Use FOR UPDATE SKIP LOCKED in Scheduling::Dispatcher scan query"

This reverts commit ca4c034051562186f58cde5b6a134056e53a0b21.

Revert "Only select strand.id column in dispatcher scan query"

This reverts commit 902e49de0dfcafdc8a125e52579cbc959ea5984b.

Revert "Checkout connection for duration of strand/scan threads in respirate"

This reverts commit f1291f36f78c6964b7ef065001f515e1abfa3ec8.

Revert "Fix default Scheduling::Dispatcher pool size"

This reverts commit 6e46cc3212cf65d491f20dd429256e866339aaa8.

Revert "Allow for configurable pool size for Scheduling::Dispatcher"

This reverts commit 27b1ac57d9838fa80e7124834c4bc729059bb53b.

Revert "Rewrite Scheduling::Dispatcher (bin/respirate)"

This reverts commit cac6951cfcb3aae2325d879037ec8fed0454dfce.
ellipsis_summary:
Reverts dispatcher rewrite and related changes due to bugs and insufficient tests, restoring previous implementation.
> 
>   - **Reverts**:
>     - Reverts dispatcher scan query to remove `FOR UPDATE SKIP LOCKED` in `scheduling/dispatcher.rb`.
>     - Reverts connection handling changes in `bin/respirate` and `scheduling/dispatcher.rb`.
>     - Reverts pool size configuration changes in `scheduling/dispatcher.rb`.
>     - Reverts overall dispatcher rewrite in `scheduling/dispatcher.rb`.
>   - **Tests**:
>     - Updates `spec/scheduling/dispatcher_spec.rb` to reflect reverted changes.
>     - Removes tests related to the reverted dispatcher features.
>   - **Misc**:
>     - Restores previous logic in `prog/test.rb` for testing purposes.
> 
>

title: Reintroduce dispatcher rewrite, with fixes
description:
This reverts the revert, and adds the following changes:

* Always use verbose_logging in tests, so that the NoMethodError will be caught in tests
* Have dispatcher spec pass the result of Dispatcher#scan to cause the error experienced in production
* Fix the error by having the Dispatcher scan query select the schedule column
* Always call Clog.emit block in the tests
* Limit respirate to using at most 15 worker threads, to match the puma thread pool size
* Add respirate smoke test, running an actual respirate process in a test environment and checking for correct behavior
* Add CI that uses the respirate smoke test
ellipsis_summary:
Reintroduces dispatcher rewrite with fixes, adds a smoke test for `respirate`, and updates CI and tests for improved dispatcher functionality and error handling.
> 
>   - **Behavior**:
>     - Reintroduces dispatcher rewrite with fixes in `scheduling/dispatcher.rb`.
>     - Fixes error by selecting the `schedule` column in `Dispatcher#scan`.
>     - Limits `respirate` to 15 worker threads to match Puma's thread pool size.
>     - Adds a smoke test for `respirate` and integrates it into CI.
>   - **Tests**:
>     - Ensures `verbose_logging` is always used in tests.
>     - Updates `dispatcher_spec.rb` to test new dispatcher behavior, including shutdown and exception handling.
>     - Ensures `Clog.emit` block is always called in tests.
> 
>

title: Add inline edit functionality for PostgreSQL firewall rules
description:
**Fix matcher for postgres resource patch endpoint**
Previously, we didn't add `true` keyword, which caused the matcher to match
every patch request, without checking if there are more segments in the path
that needs to be matched. `true` keyword ensures that the matcher matches only
the exact path and not any sub-paths. It didn't cause any problem so far, as we
only had one patch endpoint.

**Reorder firewall description and port range**
In the UI, we used to put static port information before user controlled
description. I moved the description to be before the port range, so all
the user controlled information is grouped together.

**Add edit inline button component**
This commits adds a new button component for inline editing functionality.
When clicked, it converts the text into an editable input field, allowing
users to modify the content directly on the page. Currently it only supportss
text input fields, but can be extended to support other types of inputs such
as select dropdowns or radio buttons in the future.

**Add cancel inline edit button component**
This commit adds a button that allows users to cancel the inline edit operation
they started.

**Add save inline edit button component**
This commit adds a new component for the save the changes made in the inline
edit mode.

**Add ability to inline edit PostgreSQL firewall rules**

![chrome-capture-2025-5-28](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f579ed71-6f6b-424d-b722-c3ba9410a439)
ellipsis_summary:

>     - Updates `openapi.yml` to include `patchLocationPostgresFirewallRule` for editing firewall rules.
>     - Refines path matcher in `postgres.rb` to use `r.patch true` for exact path matching.
>   - **UI Components**:

>     - Updates `icon.erb` to include `hero-pencil` and `hero-check-circle` icons.
>   - **UI Layout**:

>   - **JavaScript**:

>   - **Testing**:
